intro: Hoffmannia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian Hoffmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is typically found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Hoffmannia boliviana is considered a rare and endangered species.
